main_definition: Global Positioning System (GPS) is a satellite-based navigation system that provides location, velocity, and time information anywhere on Earth.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A technology or service used for navigating by providing real-time positioning
meanings_and_examples.example: He used his GPS device to navigate through the unfamiliar city.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The Global Positioning System, a satellite navigation system operated by the United States government
meanings_and_examples.example: Drivers rely on their car's GPS for accurate directions and turn-by-turn instructions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit of measurement representing one percent or 1/100th part of a whole, often used in relation to directional guidance
meanings_and_examples.example: The device showed a percentage indicating the distance remaining until reaching the destination.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Garbage Collection Performance Score (GPS), an indicator of how efficiently a garbage collection system operates
meanings_and_examples.example: City officials monitored their GPS to determine the effectiveness of their waste management program.
